subject: Re: [junit] Running time consuming JUnit Tests
msgSnippet: ... Well I think every project is different and it also depends how you are coding.  I run the tests all the time (several times per hour) so for me 10 minutes
messageBody:
> Actually, we have a really good separation of tests (integration,
> acceptance, unit, etc) but we prefer to run all tests no matter the type
> as often as possible, not just at integration time. I have found that
> this strategy, though sometimes time consuming (circa 600 seconds), is
> well worth it. It's much better to find out earlier that the code you
> just wrote broke the interaction of your objects than waiting for
> integration time.

Well I think every project is different and it also depends how you are
coding. I run the tests all the time (several times per hour) so for me
10 minutes per run is not acceptable (3 features/hour is not a really
fast pace...).

I still have "Install CruiseControl" on my todo list...

-Vladimir
